return {
	'goolord/alpha-nvim',
	event = "VimEnter",
	dependencies = {
		'nvim-tree/nvim-web-devicons',
		'nvim-lua/plenary.nvim'
	},
	config = function()
		require('alpha').setup(require 'alpha.themes.theta'.config)
		local startify = require("alpha.themes.startify")
		-- available: devicons, mini, default is mini
		-- if provider not loaded and enabled is true, it will try to use another provider
		startify.file_icons.provider = "devicons"
		require("alpha").setup(
			startify.config
		)
	end
}

local startify = require("alpha.themes.startify")
      -- available: devicons, mini, default is mini
      -- if provider not loaded and enabled is true, it will try to use another provider
      startify.file_icons.provider = "devicons"
      require("alpha").setup(
        startify.config
      )

Now go and navigate to any of your favorite directory, and open neovim there. If you want to edit a file (of course you downloaded it for editing files), you can go into normal mode and then run \textbf{:Ex}, which will open netrw\footnote{Netrw is the default file explorer in Neovim. Read more about it \href{https://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=1075}{here}.}. Now simply navigate and choose a file of your choice, or simply run \textbf{:e \textless{}file-name\textgreater{}} to open the file of your choice for editing.
